Projects

Current projects

EMSAfrica
biogeography
forecasting
EMSAfrica is a collaborative research project between South Africa and Germany, bringing together different scientific disciplines and approaches to understand the impacts of land-use and climate change on the structure and function of southern African terrestrial ecosystems. The data and products are used to develop and test models and produce information relevant to ecosystem management in the region.

EMMA
remote sensing
forecasting
The Ecosystem Monitoring for Management Application (EMMA) is a NASA funded project to develop a near-real-time satellite change detection system for the Fynbos Biome using an ecological forecasting approach. It is based on the proof of concept published in Slingsby et al. 2020.

NASA BioSCape Campaign
remote sensing
The Biodiversity Survey of the Cape (BioSCape) is a NASA field campaign focused on the Greater Cape Floristic Region of South Africa. It is the first ever NASA campaign focused on remote sensing of biodiversity.
No matching items

Past projects

RReTool
remote sensing
forecasting
The NRF-funded RReTool project focused on developing Rapid and Repeatable tools for monitoring and mitigating global change impacts on natural resources in South Africa, predominantly using remote sensing.
No matching items
